trans-unit.source: Provides data for the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event of a or a .

An instance of <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs> is created when the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SpeechRecognitionEngine> or <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SpeechRecognizer> object raises an `AudioSignalProblemOccurred` event.
To obtain information related to an `AudioSignalProblemOccurred` event, access the following properties in the handler for the event:
The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.AudioPosition%2A> property references the input device's position in its generated audio stream.
By contrast, the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.RecognizerAudioPosition%2A> property references the recognizer's position within its audio input.
These positions can be different.
For more information, see [Using Speech Recognition Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01c598ca-2e0e-4e89-b303-cd1cef9e8482).
The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.AudioSignalProblem%2A> property indicates which problem occurred.
<xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs> derives from <xref:System.EventArgs>.
Gets the audio level associated with the event.
The level of audio input when the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event was raised.
Gets the position in the input device's audio stream that indicates where the problem occurred.
The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.AudioPosition%2A> property references the input device's position in its generated audio stream.
By contrast, the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.RecognizerAudioPosition%2A> property references the recognizer's position within its audio input.
These positions can be different.
For more information, see [Using Speech Recognition Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01c598ca-2e0e-4e89-b303-cd1cef9e8482).
The position in the input device's audio stream when the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event was raised.
Gets the audio signal problem.
The audio signal problem that caused the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event to be raised.
Gets the position in the audio input that the recognizer has received that indicates where the problem occurred.
The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.AudioPosition%2A> property references the input device's position in its generated audio stream.
By contrast, the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.RecognizerAudioPosition%2A> property references the recognizer's position within its audio input.
These positions can be different.
For more information, see [Using Speech Recognition Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01c598ca-2e0e-4e89-b303-cd1cef9e8482).
The position in the audio input that the recognizer has received when the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event was raised.
